programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie struggles to come to terms with the news that his prize bull is gay, and Marlene finds she is missing the noise of the city after suffering sleepless nights. Tyler is delighted to learn he has failed all but two of his GCSEs, thinking he will no longer be accepted at a private school - but his parents have other ideas. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene discovers the farmhands concocting a virility potion for Rocky the bull, and manages to sneak a dose into Boycie's coffee. Make-up is found in Tyler's room, and his parents are relieved to be told he has a girlfriend - until it transpires she is also his teacher. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Jack Doolan star.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Victoria and Albert's Highland Fling
programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. Starting in Pitlochry, he traverses the Killiecrankie Pass, where the Jacobites won the Battle of Killiecrankie, and ends his trek at Balmoral and the fantasy castle Albert built as his and Victoria's Highland escape.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature length episode. When a Cambridge farmer dies beneath the blades of a combine harvester, Sam believes the death to be a tragic accident until an anonymous tip-off indicates more sinister forces are at work. Investigating the motives of the victim's neighbour, a former soldier, Sam is able to produce few solid leads. However, when the informant is found dead, the intrepid pathologist uncovers an Army cover-up. Drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh finally decides to accept Gabriel's marriage proposal, and Smithy patches up his friendship with Gina, who is feeling more amenable to his overtures now she's been given the cancer all-clear. Meanwhile, Roger agrees to investigate an assault on his estranged wife Sandra's new boyfriend Rick - whose reticence to discuss the incident is soon explained by the discovery that he's a crook.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The strain of bringing up a child begins to show on Nick, Carole doubts her abilities and a garage blaze leads to danger.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline is making Petes funeral arrangements which is stressing Arthur out! Richards gives Mandy and Adrian some bad news and Mark is not feeling well.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: All the day's business news live from Sky's City of London studio, with Ian King.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Thea already has a car sitting at home and is desperate to pass - if she stops talking long enough to listen to her examiner. Also, Mollie and Cheryl are back, hoping to improve on their catastrophic last tests. For Mollie, it would be the end of 16 years of trying - and failing - to get on the road.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: The second leg of the tour takes the boys to Italy, where they're holing up at a traditional Palazzo in Florence. Assistant Manager John Barnes thinks the lads need a bit of culture, so sends them off sightseeing to take in the Ponte Vecchio and Michelangelo's David. At training, fitness coach Luke Worthington puts the boys through their paces, but it's not looking good as the team is carrying so many injuries there are only three fit players. Plus, they've lost one of their biggest characters - Neil 'Razor' Ruddock - who had to leave the tour in Paris to return to London for tests on his heart.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Guest chef Rosemary Shrager tests the contestants' knife skills with a potato-slicing round. Six surviving players go through to the next stage where they have to butterfly a whole rainbow trout, before the final three attempt to impress her with their finished fish dish. Fern Britton hosts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: The Magic Singles of the Week
programme.desc: These are the top 20 songs we're loving right now. Stay tuned for a delicious mix of today's feel-good favourites and a huge dollop of laidback loveliness straight from the Magic HQ.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The distillation of traditional Tennessee whiskey, the inner workings of night-vision goggles and the relaxing properties of Finnish saunas.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to France to buy a bargain Citroen, but back in the workshop Edd China finds chronic problems with its self-levelling suspension.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce is doing up a wartime German tank engine so that he can pay for Glenn Miller's army uniform, a special Second World War relic.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Sr is upset not to hear from Paul Jr or Mikey as he deals with his mother's death, while OCC unveils a gold bike for Donald Trump and PJD begins a build for One Call Concepts.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: America's obsession with air superiority and the obstacles faced by the designers of advanced fighter aeroplanes.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits an operation to clean up a hazardous oil spill in Alaska, before helping to pull a car from a frozen lake in Minnesota.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes of the Lamborghini Aventador.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: How the Jaguar F-Type is produced.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: The disappearance of 21-year-old Noel Alkaramla, who vanished just before Thanksgiving 2015. In November 2017, her stepfather Johnny Oquendo was put on trial for her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Dalene Carlson. When she vanished one evening in August 2011, CCTV footage revealed several suspects, each with a motive. Jason Gilley later stood trial for kidnap, rape and murder.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: Documentary recalling how in December 2001, Michael Augustson arrived home to a scene of unspeakable horror following the fatal stabbing of his wife Melisa. The pair had only recently moved to Alma, Georgia, where they had soon been accepted by the small-town community.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Investigators discover a woman was stalked and murdered for her casino winnings when her decomposed body is found a month after her abduction.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The animal protection officers pull out all the stops to help three neglected horses that have become so desperately hungry, even sand is food.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Lewis tries to solve a mysterious condition on a dog. Plus, at Perth Zoo Dr Peter looks after an elephant and Dr Danni helps a dog with a suspected twisted stomach.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Krystle shares the spotlight with her mother, Afrodite argues with her mum over fashion and Lindsey wants hers to attend the fitting.
